The RWX file system dependency prevents deployment in multi-zone clusters. Per Laura Creed within the IBM CIO office:
Per my slack with her:
Mike: when you have time, can you help me understand why the OCP dependency we have in WebSphere Automation is an issue within CIO?
Laura: some technical issue with our existing cluster.  i think someone from that team already posted in the channel.  let me dig up his note to me
from enrique:  After many experiments, workarounds and test I contacted the WAS Operator developer, who helped me with the troubleshooting.
The problem is basically that the operator is not designed to work with multizone clusters, making the installation impossible.
The application requires RWX PVs, class ibmc-file-gold-gid, but in multizone clusters the storage class does not support RWX configuration.
The workaround, if a multizone cluster is required, consists on installing a software-defined storage solution (portwox), which has dependencies over the OpenShift Data Foundation extension, however, to install the requirement and the WAS product the cluster has to be resized at least up to 9 nodes 16x64, which will rise the cost of the OCP cluster by 3X.
I also discovered This same issue also affect the installation of Ansible Automation Hub.
Based on the previous statements, my suggestion is to install a new single-zone cluster (and perhaps shrink or delete this one)', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/OpenLiberty/open-liberty/issues/20556/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/OpenLiberty/open-liberty/issues/20556/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}}
